body.p: The Vaḷḷiyammaipurāṇam is a narrative telling the legend of Vaḷḷi, the consort of Murukaṉ. It appears to be an epitome of the Kantapurāṇam (Taylor 1845, p. 61).

Other manuscript testimonies of this text are: Bnf Indien 309; GOML D. 629 (see Rangacharya & Kuppusvami Sastri 1916, p. 630); Mackenzie MSS n° 121 C. M. 42 and n° 122 C. M. 46 (see Taylor 1845, p. 57). As GOML D. 629 is also a Mackenzie MS, it might be identical with Mackenzie MS n° 122 C. M. 46.
The bundle, a single-text manuscript, contains between the two wood-covers:
U1: 1 folio, unfoliated = title-page, by hand n° 1.
U2: 115 folios, Tamil foliation 2‒115 (f1 not explicitly foliated) = text (mūlam) and table of contents. 8 to 10 lines per page, by hand n° 2.
The text is complete, with 67 caṟukkams (Skt. sarga) and 1422 stanzas (U2, f115v6‒7).
Paratexts: marginal and in-text benedictions; title-page; marginal chapter headers; in-text chapter completion statement; colophon; table of contents with total stanzas.

U1, folio 1, recto, unfoliated = title-page: benediction, title.
(f[1]r, c1, 1‒3) veṟṟivēl uṟṟa tuṇai
(f[1]r, c2, 1) Iḵtu
(f[1]r, c2, 1‒2) vaḷḷiyammaipurāṇam

U2, folio 1, recto, unfoliated = incipit: benediction, title, chapter header; stanza n° 1 of Pāyiram.
(f[1]r, lm, 1‒2) vēlum mayilum
(f[1]r, lm, 3‒5) vaḷḷiyammaippurāṇam
(f[1]r, lm, 6) pāyiram
(f1r1) cīvakaṉ kēḻvi ṉāṭuñ ciṟantapā lāḻivāṟum ‡ pūmaka ?āka viṇṇum puṇariyā ṟutit tavāṟun ‡ tēvarkaṟ pakattil vāṟan tilatamāṉ kumari vāṟum ‡ māvakata teṣṣaṉ vāṟum māmāyai vāṟu-
(f1r2) ñ colvāṉ {pcs} 1 {pcs} (...)

Compare with the same stanza in GOML D. 629 (Rangacharya & Kuppusvami Sastri 1916, p. 632):
cīvakaṉ kēḻvi ṉāṭuñ ciṟantapā vāḻivāṟum [i.e. vāḻiyāṟum]
pūvaka lōka viṉṟum puṇariyā ṟutitta vāṟum
tēvarkaṟ pakattu vāṟum tilatamāṅ kumari yāṟum
māvakaṉ teṣṣaṉ vāṟum [i.e. takka ṉāṟum] māmāykai varavuñ colvām

U2, folio 113, verso, and folio 114, recto = excipit: chapter header; Vaḷḷiyammai-kaliyāṇa-carukkam, stanza n° 150; completion statement; Vaḷḷiyammai Iraṇṭām Piṟappu, stanzas n° 1‒6; completion statement; benediction.
(f113v, lm) vaḷḷiyammai raṇṭām [i.e. Iraṇṭām] piṟappu
(f113v1) (...) | 149 | māriyum peyap pāril maṉitarum vāḻi vāḻi ‡ ciṟiya ceṅkōl maṉṉaṉ Ulakattu ceḻit-
(f113v2) tu vāḻ ‡ pāriya centil vāḻum paramaṉār kumāraṉ ṟēvi ‡ puriya tavattāḷ vaḷḷi purāṇamē ceppi ṉāṉē | 150 | vaḷḷiyammaik-
(f113v3) kaliyāṇamuṟṟum {pcs} mātavaḷḷi (…)
(...)
(f114r7) (...) | 6 | vaḷḷiyammai reṇṭām [i.e. iraṇṭām] piṟappu muṟṟum {pcs} cuppiṟamaṇiyar kiṟupaiy uṇṭāka vēṇum {pcl} {pcs} {pcs}

Compare with the same stanza in GOML D. 629 (see Rangacharya & Kuppusvami Sastri 1916, p. 633):
māriyum peyya(p) pāril maṉitarum vīṟivāḻ
ciṟiya ceṅkōṉ maṉṉar tēcaṅkaḷ ceḻittē yāḷa
pāriya centil vāḻum paramaṉār kumaraṉ ṟēvi
puriya taṉattāḷ vaḷḷi purāṇamē ceppi ṉāṉē

U2, folio 114, verso = colophon: scribal colophon, benedictions.   
(f114v1) cārvati [i.e. cārvari] {varuṣam} vaiyyāci [i.e. vaikāci] {mācam} 30 {tēti} veḷḷikiḻamaiyum Uttira-naṣcattiramum cattamiyum kaṟkkāṭa(l/v)akkaṇamum yippaṭi-
               
(f114v2) p paṭṭa cupa-taṉattil [i.e. cupa-tiṉattil] kōvaḷam tāṉappaceṭṭiya(ṉ/ḷ) kumāraṉ kaṭaikuṭṭi mutticeṭṭi vaḷḷiyammaipurāṇam Eḻuti niṟain-
               
(f114v3) tutu [i.e. niṟaintatu] muṟṟum {pcs} kuruvē tuṇai vaḷḷiṉāyakiyammai arṣcuttuk [i.e. arccittu] kāṟkkavēṇum {pcl} {pcs} {pcl}
U2, folio 155, recto and verso = table of contents and total stanzas.

Abbreviations. c = column, f = folio, lm = left margin, r = recto, rm = right margin, U = unit (codicological and/or textual), v = verso. GOML = Government Oriental Manuscripts Library, Madras/Chennai. MTL = Madras Tamil Lexicon. TMSSML = Tanjore Maharaja Serfoji Sarasvati Mahal Library.

Unmarked puḷḷi, ō, and ē restored. Conjectural (whether the text is not clearly legible or the character is ambigous, e.g. kāl or length of o and e) readings between parentheses. Alternative readings between parentheses separated by slash. Lost or entirely illegible character: "?". Crossed-out character: "X". Conjectural restoration of lost or entirely illegible between square brackets. Uppercase for initial vowels (in excerpts only). Unquoted text represented by (...). Conjunct letter: e.g. t°, to be read tum or tam. Grantha letters in bold. Symbols/Abbreviations made explicit, between curly brackets: {pcs} = piḷḷaiyār cuḻi, short form; {pcl} = piḷḷaiyār cuḻi, long form, that is, with long horizontal stroke towards right; {varuṣam}, {mācam}, {tēti}; {line-filler}. Unfoliated folio number between square brackets, e.g. "f[1]r". Numerals normalised to decimal notation, e.g. "1121" not "1000 1 100 2 10 1". Hyphen occasionaly used to mark in-word components. Hyphen systematically used at the end of a line when the line-beginning is within a word or within a cīr. Sandhi split to the minimum: overshort u occasionally restored as an apostrophe. Stanzas split by cīr, as far as possible. aṭi boundary marked by "‡".
